section.p: TXOne StellarOne 2.0 provides following new features and enhancements.

entry.p: Users can increase protection level to stop malicious attacks by enabling the Application Lockdown. This function requires users to create an Application List and provides two modes:

li.p: Detection: The applications that are not in the Approved List will be allowed to run, and users will receive a notification.
Prevention: The applications that are not in the Approved List will be blocked from running, and users will receive a notification.

entry.p: The Application Lockdown mode can also be disabled in case users may have the needs, but it is recommended to have this function enabled.

In addition to the existing function of component update schedule for console side (StellarOne), now users can also configure the component update schedule for the agents (StellarProtect). So the system can run component update automatically at users' assigned time frequency.

This newly-added group policy allows the operators at the local side to configure the agents' policy settings on their own. Once being switched to the self-management status, the local agents are free from the StellarOne console's policy management.
Real-Time Malware Scan in Maintenance Mode
A Real-Time Malware Scan toggle switch is added under the Maintenance Mode option, reminding users to enable Real-Time Malware Scan when executing Maintenance Mode to ensure seamless protection.
Generate an API Key for Account Management
This function enables users to generate an API key and set the expiration dates for different user accounts.
